bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to C. H. Crane, November 10, 1882

div1.p: Reed requests that his orders be ready for him by November 14, 1882. A note from the Surgeon General encourages speedy processing of the request. The resulting orders re-assign Reed from the Department of the East to the Department of the Platte.

div1.head: Military Endorsements from C. H. Crane, November 10, 1882
div1.p:
7554 - S.G.O. - 1882
Reed. W. Asst.Surgn USArmy
in camp near Westminster
Mds. Nov 10/82
Asks that orders delivering
him from duty in the Dept.
of the East be ready
for him by 14th inst. as
Seles loaned over his
quarters to Dr. Moseley
S.G.O. Nov. 14, 1882.
Respectfully forwarded
to the Adjutant General
of the Army which request
that Captain Walter
Reed, Assistant Surgeon,
be relieved from duty in
the Department of the
East and ordered to report
in person to the Command-
ing General Department
of the Platte for assignment.
C.H.C.
MEDICAL OFFICERS
Walter Reed
Del.to
Asst. Mil.Surg.
D,
3088

div1.head: Military Endorsements from C.H. Crane, November 14, 1882
div1.p:
1550 A.C.P. 1882
7557 S.G.O. 1882
Near Westminster Md
Novem. 10 1882
Filed With 2959 ACP 80.
Reed Walter
Asst Surg U.S.A.

Asks that orders relieving
him from duty in the Dept.
of the East be ready for him
by the 14th inst. etc.

Forwarded by Surg. Genl. with
request that Asst. Surg. Reed be
relieved from duty in Dept. of the East and
ordered to report in person to Comd'g Gen'l
Dept. Platte for assignment to duty.

Respectfully forwarded
to the Adjutant General
of the Army with request
that Captain Walter
Reed, Assistant Surgeon,
be relieved from duty
in the Department of
the East and ordered
to report in person
to the Commanding
General Department
of the Platte for assign-
ment to duty.

Approved by the
Secretary of War
[unclear]
A.G.
Nov. 14. 82

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to C.H. Crane, November 10, 1882
div1.opener:
In Camp near Westminster, Md
Friday, Novr 10th, 1882.
Dear Doctor:
div1.p:
If it is not asking too
much, could you oblige me by having
my order relieving me in Dept. East
ready for me by the time of our arrival
in Washington, about the 14th Inst.
As statedproposed to you, when I was last
at your office, I came down and packed
my baggage, vacating my Quarters
for Dr Moseley, so that there remains
nothing for me to do upon my return,
but to turn my face westward.

I ask this favor as it would enable
me to reach my Department before
the Coldest winter weather sets in.
div1.closer:
Very truly, Yours, Walter Reed, Ass't. Surg. U.S.A.
Genl C. H. Crane,
U.S. Army,
Washington, D.C.

div1.head: Letter from John Wilson to [s.n.] Thain, November 14, 1882
div1.opener:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, D. C.,
Nov. 14, 1882.
My dear Mr. Thian:
div1.p:
The Surgeon General
is desirous of have thise order requested
in endorsement on accompanying paper
issued soon. May I ask you to make
the case special and have the order
issued as soon as possible. Dr. Reed
is all packed up ready to move and I
see by the papers that the troops from
Gaithersburg are expected to arrive at the
Washington Barracks to-day- Dr. Moseley is
already at the Barracks, and I presume
there are no quarters for Reed there.

It is suggested that a manuscript copy
of order for S. Reed be sent down here
to-day if practicable.
